LanguageData.TranslationThanks: All translations of RimWorld are fan-made. This fan-made translation was created by the following excellent volunteers:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.TranslationHowToContribute: You can contribute too. Click below to learn more (opens web browser).
LanguageData.DevBuildWarning:
Warning: This is an unstable development build. This means we are running design experiments and doing technical development.

Some things will be temporarily unbalanced on purpose. This is a classic game design method where we deliberately go too far with a balance change in order to better understand balance boundaries. We can then use that information to decide on the final balance points.

There will also be bugs, including game-breaking ones. Save compatibility may break any time.

If you're okay with all of this, thanks for testing! If you don't want to be subject to our experiments, please play the latest stable version.
LanguageData.PlanetCoverageTip: The planet is always the same diameter, but since it's far larger than needed for play, we don't generate the whole surface because it can take a very long time. This is the percentage of the surface that you want generated.
LanguageData.NoWorldsFilesFound: No world files found. Create a world first.
LanguageData.BuildNowAvailable: Version {0} is now available. Check ludeon.com for more info.
LanguageData.ConfirmDisableCoreMod: Are you sure you want to disable the core mod? The game won't work at all unless you have another mod that replaces all the core functionality.\n\nRemember, other mods can override defs in the core mod by using the same defName.
LanguageData.ConfirmDeleteMod: Are you sure you want to delete all the content for {0}?
LanguageData.DiscardModChanges: Mod changes have not been saved. Are you sure you want to continue?
LanguageData.ModReorderConflict_MustLoadAfter: Cannot move {0}: It must be loaded after {1}.
LanguageData.ModReorderConflict_MustLoadBefore: Cannot move {0}: It must be loaded before {1}.
LanguageData.ConfirmUnsubscribe: Are you sure you want to unsubscribe?
LanguageData.ConfirmUnsubscribeFrom: Are you sure you want to unsubscribe from {0}?
LanguageData.ConfirmUnsubscribeFromMultiple: Are you sure you want to unsubscribe from:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.Author: Author
LanguageData.ModOrderingWarning: This mod is loading in the wrong order relative to another mod. Use the 'auto-sort' button, or re-order the mods manually.
LanguageData.ModWithSameIdAlreadyActive: Another active mod uses the same ID: {0}.
LanguageData.ModCyclicDependency: There is a cyclic mod dependency starting with {0}.
LanguageData.ModUnsatisfiedDependency: This requires the following mods to work: {0}.
LanguageData.ModNotMadeForThisVersion: This mod was not made for this version of RimWorld, and will probably not work correctly.
LanguageData.ModNotMadeForThisVersionShort: This mod is not made for this version of RimWorld.
LanguageData.ModNotMadeForThisVersion_Newer: This mod was made for a newer version of RimWorld than this, and will probably not work correctly.
LanguageData.MessageModNeedsWellFormattedTargetVersio:
Mod needs properly formatted supported version information in About.xml. Like this:
  • {0}
    •  - is deprecated. Check log for further information.
LanguageData.MessageModNeedsWellFormattedPackageId:
Mod needs a unique, properly formatted packageId in About.xml. It must must meet following requirements:

 - Alphanumeric characters and dot only.
 - No spaces.
 - At least one dot.
 - No repeated dots in a row, or starting or ending with a dot.
 - 60 characters or less.
 - Cannot contain word "Ludeon".

For example:
<packageId>AuthorName.ModName</packageId>
<packageId>AuthorName.ModName.Specific</packageId>
LanguageData.ModHadLoadFolderIssues: This mod has issues in LoadFolders.xml, that you need to resolve before uploading:
LanguageData.ModLoadFolderDoesntExist: Folder {0} specified for version {1} doesn't exist.
LanguageData.ModLoadFolderMalformedVersion: Malformed version string '{0}'. Correct format is Major.Minor (e.g. 1.1)
LanguageData.ModLoadFolderListEmpty: The list of load folders for version {0} is empty.
LanguageData.ModLoadFolderRepeatingFolder: Version {0} lists the same folder more than once: {1}.
LanguageData.ModLoadFolderOutOfOrder: Invalid version order: {0} should come before {1}.
LanguageData.ModLoadFolderOutOfOrderDefault: Invalid version order: 'default' should be defined first.
LanguageData.ModLoadFolderDefaultDeprecated: Using 'default' in load folders is deprecated. Please define folders for each version using the <v...> tags.
LanguageData.ModLoadFolderDefinesUnsupportedGameVersi: Version {0} is defined in load folders, but is not listed in 'supportedVersions' of mod's About.xml.
LanguageData.TextFieldsMustBeFilled: All text fields must be filled.
LanguageData.ConfirmSteamWorkshopUpload:
Are you sure you want to upload this to the Steam Workshop?

You must agree to the Steam Workshop terms of service. Find the full terms here:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/workshoplegalagreement
LanguageData.ConfirmContentAuthor: Obviously you should only upload content that you created yourself.\n\nDid you create this content yourself?
LanguageData.CanBeUpdatedOnWorkshop: Can be updated on Workshop, since you are the author.
LanguageData.ScenarioChangedSavePrompt: This scenario has been edited.\n\nDo you want to save it before proceeding?
LanguageData.HowStorytellersWork: The AI Storyteller creates events like pirate raids, resource drops, or animal attacks. Their choices will affect the story of your colony. You can change these settings at any time.
LanguageData.MustChoosePermadeath: Please choose commitment mode or reload anytime mode.
LanguageData.ReloadAnytimeModeInfo: You can save and load the game at any time.\n\nThis is a good choice if you're still learning the game, if it fits your personal playstyle, if you're using mods that may break your game, or if you intend to self-enforce commitment mode.
LanguageData.PermadeathModeInfo:
You can only save when quitting the game.

Since RimWorld is a story generator, even losing all but one person is not the end of the game - it's part of the story. The game is designed to allow recovery after losses.

Playing out these terrible situations makes a story with both tragedy and triumph. It's the way RimWorld was designed to be played.

There's a reason Luke Skywalker didn't quit and reload when his family got killed - loss and recovery is dramatic.
LanguageData.CanChangeStorytellerSettingsDuringPlay: Storyteller and playstyle can be changed any time.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ThreatScale_Info: Adjust the size of threats like raids and infestations, and the difficulty of quests.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowBigThreats_Info: Allow major threats such as raids, infestations, manhunter packs, crashed mechanoid ships and more.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowViolentQuests_Info: Allow quests to present with violent threats and challenges. If this is disabled, quests will be modified to be non-violent.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowIntroThreats_Info: Enable the fixed intro threats that appear near game start.
LanguageData.Difficulty_PredatorsHuntHumanlikes_Info: Allow wild predators to hunt humans.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowExtremeWeatherIncidents_: Allow extreme weather incidents such as toxic fallout, volcanic winters and flashstorms.
LanguageData.Difficulty_TradePriceFactorLoss_Info: When trading, buy prices are increased by this amount while sell prices are reduced by this amount.
LanguageData.Difficulty_CropYieldFactor_Info: Adjust the amount of materials produced when harvesting plants and crops. This includes harvesting plants and cutting trees.
LanguageData.Difficulty_MineYieldFactor_Info: Adjust the amount of materials produced when mining.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ButcherYieldFactor_Info: Adjust the amount of materials produced when butchering. This includes meat, leather, and yield from shredding mechanoids.
LanguageData.Difficulty_QuestRewardValueFactor_Info: Adjust the value of rewards given for quests.\n\nNote: Quest reward value is also automatically scaled to compensate for threat scale. If you adjust this setting, you'll be adding an additional multiplier.
LanguageData.Difficulty_RaidLootPointsFactor_Info: Adjust the value of loot carried by raiders.\n\nNote: Raid loot value is also automatically scaled to compensate for threat scale. If you adjust this setting, you'll be adding an additional multiplier.
LanguageData.Difficulty_MaintenanceCostFactor_Info: Adjust the cost of rearming turrets.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ScariaRotChance_Info: The probability that a corpse will immediately rot upon death, if the creature has the scaria disease.\n\nNote: The default settings are designed to exactly balance out the increase in animal count at higher difficulties, so all players get the same meat rewards.
LanguageData.Difficulty_EnemyDeathOnDownedChanceFacto: Adjust the extra chance that an enemy will immediately die when downed. This affects the chances to take prisoners, and thus colony population growth rates.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ColonistMoodOffset_Info: A permanent mood offset applied to every colonist and prisoner. Colonists have a base mood of 50%.
LanguageData.Difficulty_FoodPoisonChanceFactor_Info: Adjust the chance that a person will get food poisoning from eating a potentially-poisoned meal.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ManhunterChanceOnDamageFactor: Adjust the chance that injuring a wild animal will cause it to attack.
LanguageData.Difficulty_FriendlyFireChanceFactor_Info: Adjust the chance of friendly fire.\n\nNote: This setting only affects direct shots which were going to hit their target. It does not prevent damage from explosions, or from shots which were going to miss their target.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowInstantKillChance_Info: Adjust the chance that a colonist can die instantly due to an attack. The incoming damage is adjusted so it will down the colonist instead.\n\nThis only prevents some kinds of instant kills - colonists can still be downed and bleed to death, die from fire, explosions, disease, and so on.
LanguageData.Difficulty_PlayerPawnInfectionChanceFact: Adjust the chance that a wound will become infected.
LanguageData.Difficulty_DiseaseIntervalFactor_Inverte: Adjust the frequency of random disease events.
LanguageData.Difficulty_EnemyReproductionRateFactor_I: Adjust the rate at which existing insect hives spawn new insects. Lower values means more time between spawn events.\n\nThis does not affect whether infestations can occur - only the speed at which active hives produce insects.
LanguageData.Difficulty_DeepDrillInfestationChanceFac: Adjust the chance that deep drilling will trigger an infestation.
LanguageData.Difficulty_PeacefulTemples_Inverted_Info: Ancient structures may contain dangerous threats.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowCaveHives_Info: Dormant insect hives may spawn in natural caves.\n\nThis setting only applies to map generation and does not affect active insects that may tunnel in during play.
LanguageData.Difficulty_UnwaveringPrisoners_Info:
This option adds additional capturable prisoners to the game who cannot be recruited due to unwavering loyalty.

Unwavering prisoners are added on top of normal prisoners, so turning this off won't give more recruitable prisoners - it simply removes the unwavering ones.

Unwavering prisoners can still be released for diplomatic gains, sold, enslaved, harvested for organs, or otherwise made use of. In general, they offer more options and resources, and make the game a bit richer and easier.
LanguageData.Difficulty_NomadicMineableResourcesFacto: Adjust how many mineable resources are generated on maps after your first.\n\nNote: Your first colony map will always generate with the standard amount of resources.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowTraps_Info: Player can build traps like spike traps and IED traps.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowTurrets_Info: Player can build static turrets like mini-turrets, autocannon turrets, and uranium slug turrets.\n\nYou can still use captured turrets even if this is disabled.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AllowMortars_Info: Player can build mortars.\n\nYou can still use captured mortars even if this is disabled.
LanguageData.Difficulty_ClassicMortars_Info: Mortars will not require reinforced barrels to construct or reload, and are balanced for this ease of access.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AdaptationGrowthRateFactorOve: Adaptation means the storyteller makes the game more challenging when you're doing well. An adaptation score grows over time, and is knocked down when you take damage.\n\nThis setting adjusts how fast the adaptation score grows over time.
LanguageData.Difficulty_AdaptationEffectFactor_Info: Adaptation means the storyteller makes the game more challenging when you're doing well. An adaptation score grows over time, and is knocked down when you take damage.\n\nThis setting adjusts how much the adaptation score affects the difficulty.
LanguageData.Difficulty_FixedWealthMode_Info:
Play in a wealth-independent progress mode.

In normal mode, the storyteller scales threats according to colonist count, player wealth, and a variety of other factors. Wealth-independent mode removes the wealth factor and replaces it with a fixed progress curve based on time. The time is counted from the founding of each colony.

This is only recommended for those looking for a strict skill challenge. In wealth-independent mode, it may be nearly impossible to recover from serious losses unless you found a new settlement. It's also possible to get too far ahead of the curve and find the game too easy.
LanguageData.Difficulty_FixedWealthTimeFactor_Info: The number of game years until the wealth-independent mode reaches its maximum threat level.\n\nNote that the storyteller will still scale threats according to colonist count and a variety of other factors.
LanguageData.Difficulty_LowPopConversionBoost_Info:
With a single colonist of the player's starting ideoligion, conversion chance to their ideoligion is multiplied by this amount. Conversion attempts against them have their impact divided by that amount.

With two colonists of the player's starting ideoligion, the effect is halved.

With three or more colonists of the player's starting ideoligion, this has no effect.
LanguageData.CannotLandBiome: You cannot land on this biome: {0}
LanguageData.CannotLandImpassableMountains: You cannot land on impassable mountains.
LanguageData.YourBaseAlreadyThere: You already have a base there.
LanguageData.FactionBaseAdjacent: Settlements cannot be directly adjacent to each other.
LanguageData.FirstNameDesc: The character's first name.\n\nThis is only displayed in certain menus.
LanguageData.ShortIdentifierDesc: The character's short identifier.\n\nThis is displayed at all times. It can be the first or last name, or a completely separate nickname.
LanguageData.LastNameDesc: The character's last name.\n\nThis is only displayed in certain menus.
LanguageData.GuiltyDesc: This person is considered guilty. Others won't be bothered if you banish, execute or arrest them.\n\nGuilt expires in
LanguageData.ConfirmQuit: Really quit? You'll lose unsaved progress.
LanguageData.EveryoneNeedsValidName: Each person needs a valid name.
LanguageData.RequiredWorkTypeDisabledForEveryone: None of the selected people can do the following jobs
LanguageData.FactionSelectionDesc: Select the factions in the world. You can select up to {0} factions total.
LanguageData.FactionDisabledContentWarning: Disabling {0} means less quest variety and other reduced content.
LanguageData.InsectsDisabledContentWarning: Disabling {0} means less spontaneous threat variety.
LanguageData.MechanoidsDisabledContentWarning: Disabling {0} means less quest and spontaneous threat variety.
LanguageData.FactionsDisabledWarning: Without other factions, raids, trading, and quests won't occur as normal.
LanguageData.FactionRemovalDisabled: Cannot be removed for this scenario.
